files.description: Project overview and quickstart describing how the Python CLI generates community protocol drafts, technical requirements, validation study designs, and phased rollout milestones for provenance-aware primary-source psychology scholarship.
Python project configuration defining dependencies, entry points for the CLI, and tooling settings for reproducible execution.
Package initializer exposing the public CLI entry function and version metadata.
Command-line interface that collects inputs (scope, corpora, stakeholders, repositories) and writes a complete implementable plan plus artifacts into an output directory.
Typed dataclass models for stakeholders, protocol components (checklists, schemas), plugin/software requirements, study designs (survey + audit), and rollout milestones with measurable metrics.

End-to-end plan generator that composes stakeholder engagement steps, technical requirements, validation designs, and phased rollout into a structured markdown plan with traceable acceptance criteria.
Artifact writers that emit draft protocol checklists, metadata schema (JSON Schema), repository citation guidelines, and plugin/spec stubs as separate files alongside the main plan.

Detailed technical specification generator for lightweight detection/annotation software/plugins covering edition/translation provenance, variant pagination/paragraph markers, and public-domain repository citations.

Generators for implementable survey instruments and audit study protocols including sampling plans, coding rubrics, inter-rater reliability measures, and analysis plans for adoption/accuracy evaluation.
Phased rollout planner that produces timelines, governance checkpoints, adoption targets, and evaluation milestones (usage metrics, endorsement counts, quality/accuracy thresholds).
Built-in default templates and controlled vocabularies for stakeholder roles, checklist items, metadata fields, repository citation forms, and milestone metric definitions.
Automated tests verifying the CLI and generators produce deterministic, complete outputs (plan + artifacts) containing required sections, measurable milestones, and valid JSON Schema.

missionDescription: Design a detailed, implementable plan to produce community-endorsed protocols (checklists, metadata schemas) and lightweight software/plugins that detect and annotate edition/translation provenance, variant pagination/paragraph markers, and public-domain repository citations for primary-source psychology scholarship. The plan should specify stakeholder engagement, technical requirements, validation study designs (surveys + audit studies), and a phased rollout with measurable adoption and evaluation milestones.
missionSuccessCriteria: Deliver a prioritized feature list and metadata schema draft that covers edition/translation provenance, variant page/paragraph identifiers, and canonical public-domain repository links (e.g., PsychClassics, Project Gutenberg).
Produce a stakeholder engagement and community-endorsement roadmap (target journals, archives, professional societies) with at least three concrete endorsement or pilot partners identified.

Specify two empirical validation study protocols: (a) a survey instrument to measure researcher ease-of-use and perceived reproducibility gains, and (b) an audit study comparing citation accuracy and reproducibility across intervention vs. control samples, including sample sizes, metrics, and analysis plan.

Provide a phased technical implementation plan (minimum viable plugin/tool features, tech stack, integration points with common workflows such as Zotero, reference managers, and manuscript submission systems) and success metrics for adoption and citation accuracy improvement.
